page.title: 18DEVONSHIRE DIALECT
page.content: Mos li'l towns in S.E. Englan be havin gude taams.Buckfastlay is the zame;praper buzy buslin li'l plaace tiz.Like s not the traffic be that thik a laady can ardly struggl droo it to git frum wan zide to t'other.Tis vortunete a beeg double rawd gows round the town and lucky sure 'nough a girt quarry lies andy so the stawn for the rawd is aisy to come by.Most of the auld traads be gawn- tiz all these li'l modern workshops nowadays,tho they do steel dress the skins and tiddyvaat em and zend em to vorin parts.The volks ere be most friendly and always maandful of thur neyburs.Buckfastlay is wurld vamus for the kaves and visiters come from all auver to enjoy the ills around Dartmoor and the bootiful meadas of the Zouth Ams s'far as the zay.
